SEARCH
Package imagingbook.common.util.tuples

Interface Tuple

All Known Implementing Classes:
Tuple2, Tuple3, Tuple4
public interface Tuple

Elementary implementation of tuples, i.e, ordered sequences of items of arbitrary types. Tuples are generally immutable and their main use is to get methods return multiple values with maximum compile-time safety. A concrete tuple class is defined for each "arity", e.g., Tuple2 for 2 elements. Currently tuple classes for 2, 3 and 4 elements are defined.

A tuple may be instantiated using either the class constructor, e.g., 

new Tuple2<Integer, String>(10, "Foo")

or the associated static method 

Tuple2.of(10, "Foo")
Individual tuple elements can be accessed (read-only) by the associated field names, e.g. f0, f1 ... etc. There are no getter methods.
